info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 2:58PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHERN KENTON, NORTHWESTERN BRACKEN, CAMPBELL, NORTHEASTERN GRANT, PENDLETON AND SOUTHWESTERN CLERMONT COUNTIES THROUGH 345 PM EDT... At 258 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Williamstown, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, penny size hail, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Alexandria, Williamstown, Falmouth, Claryville, New Richmond, Dry Ridge, Butler, Morgan, Mentor, Moscow, Neville, California, Chilo, Mount Auburn, Willow Grove, Bradford, Grants Lick, Northcutt, Gubser Mill and Gardnersville. This includes I-75 in Kentucky near mile marker 160. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. Residents in these areas should remain alert. If this storm becomes stronger, then a warning may be needed. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for northern Kentucky...and southwestern Ohio. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch also remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for southwestern Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
